repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
`runtime/plugin/shada.vim` is hard to read and maintain.

Solution:
Switch it to Lua.

comment_data.body: @justinmk is this still necessary as 'cpoptions' seem to be about Vi-compatibility? I think we can just set `vim.bp[ev.buf].modified = false` as I also don't see when `ev.file` would not equal to `vim.fn.bufname(ev.buf)`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,88 @@
+if vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin then
+  return
+end
+vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin = 1
+
+local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.shada', {})
+local pattern = { '*.shada', '*.shada.tmp.[a-z]' }
+
+---@type fun(binstrings: string[]): string[]
+local shada_get_strings = vim.fn['shada#get_strings']
+---@type fun(strings: string[]): string[]
+local shada_get_binstrings = vim.fn['shada#get_binstrings']
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufReadCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    local l = vim.fn.line('.') - 1
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(ev.buf, l, l, true, shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+    vim.bo[ev.buf].filetype = 'shada'
+  end,
+})
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileReadCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    -- vim.fn.append("'[", shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+    local mark_line = vim.fn.line("'[") - 1
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(ev.buf, mark_line, mark_line, true, shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+  end,
+})
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufWriteCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    local buflines = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(0, 0, -1, false)
+    local err = vim.fn.writefile(shada_get_binstrings(buflines), ev.file, 'b')
+    if not err then
+      local modified
+      if ev.file == vim.fn.bufname(ev.buf) then
+        modified = false
+      else
+        modified = vim.o.cpoptions:find('+', 1, true) ~= nil

comment_data.body:
if you're going to abstract this then might as well use it to save more code?
```suggestion
local function def_autocmd(event, opts, fn)
  ...
  opts.callback = function(ev)
    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
      error('++opt not supported')
    end
    fn(ev)
  end
  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(event, opts)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,90 @@
+if vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin then
+  return
+end
+vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin = 1
+
+local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.shada', {})
+local pattern = { '*.shada', '*.shada.tmp.[a-z]' }
+
+---Ensures that pattern and augroup are set correctly.
+---@param event string|string[]
+---@param opts vim.api.keyset.create_autocmd
+local function shada_autocmd(event, opts)

@@ -0,0 +1,90 @@
+if vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin then
+  return
+end
+vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin = 1
+
+local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.shada', {})
+local pattern = { '*.shada', '*.shada.tmp.[a-z]' }
+
+---Ensures that pattern and augroup are set correctly.
+---@param event string|string[]
+---@param opts vim.api.keyset.create_autocmd
+local function shada_autocmd(event, opts)

comment_data.body: Hi, sort of late to the party, but `ev.file` may not be the same as `vim.fn.bufname(ev.buf)` if the buffer is saved under a different name with `:w [some other filename]`. Then, `ev.buf` and `ev.match` will be `some other filename`. This is really nitpicky though, should I submit a PR for this little change?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,88 @@
+if vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin then
+  return
+end
+vim.g.loaded_shada_plugin = 1
+
+local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.shada', {})
+local pattern = { '*.shada', '*.shada.tmp.[a-z]' }
+
+---@type fun(binstrings: string[]): string[]
+local shada_get_strings = vim.fn['shada#get_strings']
+---@type fun(strings: string[]): string[]
+local shada_get_binstrings = vim.fn['shada#get_binstrings']
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufReadCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    local l = vim.fn.line('.') - 1
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(ev.buf, l, l, true, shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+    vim.bo[ev.buf].filetype = 'shada'
+  end,
+})
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileReadCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    -- vim.fn.append("'[", shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+    local mark_line = vim.fn.line("'[") - 1
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(ev.buf, mark_line, mark_line, true, shada_get_strings(vim.fn.readfile(ev.file, 'b')))
+  end,
+})
+
+vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufWriteCmd', {
+  group = augroup,
+  pattern = pattern,
+  callback = function(ev)
+    if vim.v.cmdarg ~= '' then
+      error('++opt not supported')
+    end
+    local buflines = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(0, 0, -1, false)
+    local err = vim.fn.writefile(shada_get_binstrings(buflines), ev.file, 'b')
+    if not err then
+      local modified
+      if ev.file == vim.fn.bufname(ev.buf) then
+        modified = false
+      else
+        modified = vim.o.cpoptions:find('+', 1, true) ~= nil

comment_data.body:
It seems like you're right. PR is definitely worth it: current behaviour is incorrect and should therefore be fixed. 

If this plugin already has a test file, it may also be worth it to add a test case for it.

comment_regular_data.body: This should be ready for review / merge :)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(shada): switch plugin/shada.vim to Lua
